requirements.name: Windows NT 3.1 Advanced Server
storage: 110 megabytes of hard drive space in RISC
requirements.network: A network interface card (NIC) and appropriate drivers that support multiple network protocols: NetBEUI (NBF), TCP/IP, and DLC
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft-compatible pointing device is recommended, but not required

requirements.name: Windows NT 3.5 Server
cpu: DEC Alpha or MIPS processors were also supported
A computer with multiple processors was also supported
requirements.network: A 16- or 32-bit Ethernet or Token Ring NIC was necessary for network connectivity. This release introduced significant enhancements to the TCP/IP stack, including support for NetBIOS over TCP/IP (NetBT) and Microsoft's DHCP and WINS clients and servers.
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft-compatible pointing device is recommended, but not required

requirements.name: Windows NT 3.5 Server
media: 1.44 MB or 1.2 MB floppy disk drive
requirements.network: Network interface card (for networking). For networking, it can utilize TCP/IP, NetBEUI, and IPX/SPX protocols, and it has built-in WAN capabilities via Remote Access Service (RAS)
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft-compatible pointing device is recommended, but not required

requirements.name: Minimum
storage: IDE, EIDE, SCSI or ESDI with 128 MB free spice
requirements.network: Network Interface Card (NIC) needed
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft mouse or compatible pointing device

requirements.name: Recommended
storage: IDE, EIDE, SCSI or ESDI with 256 MB free spice
requirements.network: Network Interface Card (NIC) needed
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft mouse or compatible pointing device

requirements.name: Minimum
requirements.network: A network card (Ethernet, etc.) is necessary to physically connect to a network
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft mouse or compatible pointing device

requirements.name: Recommended
requirements.network: A network card (Ethernet, etc.) is necessary to physically connect to a network
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft mouse or compatible pointing device

name: Windows Server 2003
facts: It is the final version of Windows Server that supports processors without ACPI. IA-64 and x64 builds of Windows Server 2003 as well as Windows Server 2008 and later strictly require ACPI
Windows Server 2003 is the first server edition of Windows to support the IA-64 and x64 architectures
Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates stated that Windows Server 2003 was Microsoft's 'most rigorously tested software to date'

requirements.name: Minimum
cpu: Enterprise server: 133MHz for x86-based computers; 733MHz for Itanium-based computers
storage: Enterprise server:  1.5GB for x86-based for setup computers; 2.0GB for Itanium-based computers
vga: Monitor and adapter with minimum resolution of the VGA standard
requirements.network: A compotable network adapter and related cables
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft mouse or compatible pointing device

requirements.name: Recommended
storage: Enterprise server:  1.5GB for x86-based for setup computers; 2.0GB for Itanium-based computers
vga: Monitor and adapter with minimum resolution of the VGA standard
requirements.network: A compatable network adapter and related cables
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft mouse or compatible pointing device

name: Windows Server 2008
editions: Windows Server 2008 Foundation (codenamed 'Lima'; x86-64) for OEMs only
Windows HPC Server 2008 (codenamed 'Socrates'; replacing Windows Compute Cluster Server)
Windows Storage Server 2008 (codenamed 'Magni'; IA-32 and x86-64)
Windows Small Business Server 2008 (codenamed 'Cougar'; x86-64) for small businesses
Windows Essential Business Server 2008 (codenamed 'Centro'; x86-64) for medium-sized businesses[40] - this edition was discontinued in 2010
facts: It removed support for computers without ACPI, and is the first version that includes Hyper-V
It is the last version of Windows Server that supports 32-bit processors (IA-32)

requirements.name: Minimum
requirements.network: A compatible network adapter is needed (either wired or wireless)
requirements.mouse: Mouse or compatible pointing device

requirements.name: Recommended
cpu: Number of physical processors: Standard - 4; Enterprise - 8; Datacenter: 32
Logical processors when Hyper-V is disabled: IA-32 - 32; x64 - 64
Logical processors when Hyper-V is enabled: IA-32 - N/A, x64 - 24
ram: On IA-32: Standard, Web - 4 GB; Enterprise, Datacenter: 64 GB
Maximum memory on x64: Standard, Web - 32 GB; HPC - 128 GB; Enterprise, Datacenter - 1 TB
requirements.network: A compatible network adapter is needed (either wired or wireless)
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft-compatible pointing device is recommended, but not required

name: Windows Server 2008 R2
editions: Windows Server 2008 Foundation (codenamed 'Lima'; x86-64) for OEMs only
Windows HPC Server 2008 (codenamed 'Socrates'; replacing Windows Compute Cluster Server)
Windows Storage Server 2008 (codenamed 'Magni'; IA-32 and x86-64)
Windows Small Business Server 2008 (codenamed 'Cougar'; x86-64) for small businesses
Windows Essential Business Server 2008 (codenamed 'Centro'; x86-64) for medium-sized businesses[40] - this edition was discontinued in 2010
licenses: Commercial software (Retail, volume licensing, Microsoft Software Assurance)

requirements.name: Minimum
requirements.network: A compatible network adapter is needed (either wired or wireless)
requirements.mouse: Mouse or compatible pointing device

requirements.name: Recommended
cpu: Number of physical processors: Standard - 4; Enterprise - 8; Datacenter: 64
Logical processors when Hyper-V is disabled: 256
Logical processors when Hyper-V is enabled: 64
ram: Maximum memory on x64: Foundation - 8 GB; Standard, Web - 32 GB; HPC - 128 GB; Enterprise, Datacenter - 2 TB
requirements.network: A compatible network adapter is needed (either wired or wireless)
requirements.mouse: A Microsoft-compatible pointing device is recommended, but not required
